summary: Barbara L. Mosley was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. The documents list her as an employee, including her annual salary and gross pay for the specified periods. The documents do not specify her exact role within the SCAS, but her presence on payroll certifications indicates she held a staff position.
significance: Barbara L. Mosley's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of her contribution are not detailed in the provided documents.
